pages.text: To start delving into Spectrum you first have to find some gemstone shards.\\Each kind of gemstone represents an elemental color and a different kind of natural force.

pages.title: Topaz Shards
pages.text: Topaz Shards lie surprisingly heavy in your hand. This gemstone quickly turned out to be one of the most robust materials you've ever gotten your hands on - perhaps only surpassed by diamond. Topaz is found in geodes at the very top of steep hills and on the tops of sky-high mountains.\The Topaz represents $(c_cyan)**MATTER**.[#]()

pages.title: Amethyst Shards
pages.text: Magenta light refracts in this gemstone.\Formed over eons in the geodes, this gemstone radiates awe. It is a symbol of permanence and found in the deepest layers of the world.\\The Amethyst represents $(c_purple)**TIME**[#]().

pages.title: Citrine Shards
pages.text: This yellow gemstone is found close to surface level where the suns light dissipates into warmth.\\Its bright yellow luster radiates pure $(c_yellow)**ENERGY**[#]() and makes it slightly warm to the touch at all times.

pages.title: Onyx Shards
pages.text: Onyx is nearly pitch black. It almost seems as if it drains the light from its surroundings.\\The Onyx, as a combination of energy, matter, and time, serves as a reinforcing focus and [#](000000)**CATALYST**[#]() for magical tools and devices.

pages.title: Moonstone Shards
pages.text: It's bluish-white shimmer reminds you of the soothing light of the moon on a calm summer night. The tranquility it exudes leaves a calming, yet significant impression, like a sleeping cat - balm for the soul and yet a predator, always on guard.\\The Moonstone embodies pure [#](ffffff)**MAGIC**[#]().
